meanings.sent1: I need to exchange my dollars for guaranies before my trip.
meanings.sent2: In Paraguay, you can buy souvenirs using guaranies.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine only accepts guaranies, so I guess I won't be having any snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a handful of guaranies.
meanings.sent5: The sound of coins clinking together filled the air as he counted his guaranies.

meanings.definition: A member of an indigenous people of Paraguay.
meanings.sent1: The Guarani people have a rich cultural heritage.
meanings.sent2: She learned about the Guarani tribe in history class.
meanings.sent3: The Guarani elder told a funny joke that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: She was as strong and resilient as a Guarani warrior.
meanings.sent5: The Guarani children played happily in the village square.

meanings.definition: The language of the Guarani people.
meanings.sent1: Learning Guarani is a fun challenge for me.
meanings.sent2: She spoke Guarani fluently with her family.
meanings.sent3: The parrot in the zoo tried to mimic the Guarani words it heard.
meanings.sent4: His words in Guarani painted a vivid picture of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The Guarani songs echoed through the valley, enchanting all who heard.
